text: Instead, she first broke ground in her early career as a member of the early'90s dance troupe, The Fly Girls, on the sketch comedy TV show, In Living Color. But, as a self - described ` ` camera hog'' influenced by the movie musicals of her childhood, it wasn't long before she was on the silver screen and in the studio. ` ` I watched a lot of musicals because of my mom and that influenced me very much in the fact that a career in this business would have to be all three,'' she explained to James Lipton on Inside the Actors Studio. She inched closer toward movie star with films like Money Train and Jack before landing the role of a lifetime as Selena Quintanilla in the eponymous 1997 film. By 27, she was a Golden Globe nominee.
